title: HIGH SCHOOL BOYS BASKETBALL: Former Herald Dream Teamer Tommy Mobley of Newton North verbals to Amherst | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark
text:
Three-time Boston Herald All-Scholastic guard Tommy Mobley of Newton North announced that he will attend Amherst in the fall of 2016.
The 6-foot-3 shooting guard finished with 1,604 points, second in school history behind Anthony Gurley (1,850). As a senior, Mobley averaged 22.6 points, six rebounds and three assists a game in leading the Tigers to the Division 1 South semifinals. A lethal 3-point shooter, Mobley knocked down 309 three-pointers and shot 88 percent from the line. He is currently doing a postgraduate year at Phillips Exeter.
"My biggest priority throughout my entire recruiting process was to go to the best academic school that I could," Mobley said. "I had offers from two Division 1 schools, but at Amherst, I will be getting a world class education and I will play for a national championship."
Mobley played his AAU basketball for Leo Papile and the BABC. He excelled against top-flight competition, including breakout performances at the Nike EYBL.
